tit.e: Chinshin-ryu School (a school of tea ceremony)
Chinshin-ryu School (a school of tea ceremony)

sen.j: 鎮信流 （ちんしんりゅう）は、肥前平戸藩で伝えられた茶道の流派。
sen.e: Chinshinryu is a school of tea ceremony that has been passed down in the Hirado clan in Hizen Province.
Chinshin-ryu school is a school of tea ceremony passed down by the Hirado clan in Hizen Province.
Chinshin-ryu school is a school of tea ceremony passed down by the Hirado clan in Hizen Province.

sen.j: 4代藩主松浦鎮信 (天祥)が片桐貞昌に学び、また様々な流儀を研究して打ち立てた。
sen.e: The fourth lord of the domain, Shigenobu MATSUURA (Tensho), founded the school after he studied under Sadamasa KATAGIRI, and after also learning various styles.
The fourth lord of the domain, Shigenobu MATSURA (also known as Tensho), founded the school after he studied under Sadamasa KATAGIRI, and after also learning various schools.

sen.j: 石州流鎮信派とも。
sen.e: It is also called the Chinshin-ha line of the Sekishu School.
It is also called the Chinshin-ha group of the Sekishu-ryu school.

sen.j: 現在宗家は藤沢市にある。
sen.e: Currently, the Soke (head of the school) is located in Fujisawa City.

sen.j: 松浦鎮信 (天祥)は平戸藩の4代藩主であった。
sen.e: Shigenobu MATSUURA (Tensho) was the fourth lord of Hirado domain.

sen.j: 若年より茶道を好んだ。
sen.e: He enjoyed tea ceremony from a young age.

sen.j: 家臣に金森重近から伝授を受けさせ、遠州流、三斎流、古市流、有楽流なども研究していた。
sen.e: He had his vassal receive instructions from Shigechika KANAMORI and studied the styles of the Enshu, Sansai, Furuichi and Uraku schools.

sen.e: He had his vassal receive instructions from Shigechika KANAMORI and studied the styles of the schools of Enshu-ryu, Sansai-ryu, Furuichi-ryu and Uraku-ryu.

sen.j: しかし、壮年に至って片桐貞昌に師事して藤林宗源より皆伝を受けた。
sen.e: However, when he was older, he studied under Sadamasa KATAGIRI, and he was certified fully proficient by Sogen FUJIBAYASHI.

sen.j: そこで石州流を基本としてそこに各流儀の長所を加えて一派を打ち立てた。
sen.e: He then established a school based on the Sekishu school, adding positive attributes from various styles.

sen.j: 石州流での弟弟子にあたる村松伊織を茶堂として迎えた。
sen.e: He brought in his junior disciple, Iori MURAMATSU, as a sado (person in charge of tea ceremony).

sen.j: これに豊田の姓を与えて代々伝授させた。
sen.e: He gave him a family name of Toyoda and let the successive generations of this family give instructions.

sen.j: 大名家の常として当主自らが茶道を伝承することはなく、茶堂より伝授を受けるのであった。
sen.e: Unlike the tradition of the daimyo (feudal lord) families, the instructions in tea ceremony were passed down by the sado and not by the lord himself.

sen.e: However, the eighth lord of the domain, Sanenobu MATSUURA, was so talented that his proficiency was certified at the age of 17.

sen.j: 12代藩主松浦詮のときに維新を迎えた。

sen.e: He transferred the iemoto (head family of a school) from the Toyoda family and changed the name to the Chinshin school.

sen.j: そして、東京で自ら茶道の指導を行うようになる。
sen.e: He then began to give instructions in tea ceremony himself in Tokyo.

sen.e: In particular, he taught tea ceremony at Gakushuin Girl's Junior and Senior High School and Japan Women's University.
